description: A mother who cannot breastfeed directly, can use a clean cup to feed her infant.
title: A mother who cannot breastfeed directly, can use a clean cup to feed her infant
content:
- The best food for a baby who cannot be breastfed directly is milk
   expressed from the mother's breast, given from a clean, open cup.

 - Cup feeding is safer than bottle feeding because the cup can be
   easily cleaned with soap and water. 

 - Cup feeding also provides some of the contact and stimulation the   
   baby needs, since the person has to hold the baby.

 - Feeding with a cup does not cause problems with suckling at the
   breast.

 - Even newborn babies can be fed with an open cup. If it is necessary
   to feed a baby with a nutritionally adequate breastmilk substitute,
   it should be fed to the baby by cup.
